intro: Geranium wakkerstroomianum, commonly known as Wakkerstroom geranium, is a perennial herb native to South Africa. It belongs to the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, palmate leaves and showy, pink to red flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, aiding in its propagation. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is often cultivated in gardens and rockeries.
